conclusion: The problem involves finding the internal resistance of a power supply using given resistance and voltage readings.
The circuit diagram shows a resistance box labeled R, an ideal voltmeter labeled V, a power supply with internal resistance labeled r, and a switch labeled S.
When the resistance box reads R1 = 2Ω, the voltmeter reads U1 = 3V.
When the resistance box reads R2 = 6Ω, the voltmeter reads U2 = 4.5V.
The internal resistance r of the power supply is calculated to be 3Ω.
